page.title: 03BLISTS HILL
page.content: Blists hill is an open air museum that has been open for fifteen years and they are still adding bits to it. The latest exhibit is the cast iron works which is still under construction. A half hour survey of visitors on Thursday 25th April 1985 showed that they came from as far as Preston, Sheffield and France. The busiest month is August with over 28,000 visitors.The total attendance for 1984 was over 176,000. The museum is set in the mid 19th century.The favourite attractions are the {Squatters cottage},the{Toll house and the{Butchers shop.} Sometimes the museum trust holds special events like steame rallies and Victorian days when visitors are asked to dress up in period costume.
